newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates edge lower at mid-session.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates edge lower at mid-session.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates fell at midday on Thursday, but dealers expected the rates to stay around the current level later in the session due to a relatively stable liquidity.

The overnight interbank rate was at 5.997 percent against Wednesday's 6.027 percent close -- still outside the central bank's 5.00-5.5 percent target zone -- with 30-day commercial paper falling to 6.00 percent against 6.10.
The maturation of T$5 billion negotiable certificates of deposit on Thursday would help ease funds in the banking system, dealers said.
In the bond market, the 10-year 86/4 bond yield was at 6.0805-0815 percent against 6.0850-0855.
